recipe.title: How to Make Eggs on Toast

procedure.summary: Warm a greased skillet over medium heat.
procedure.description: Add butter, oil, or any other type of cooking fat to a medium-sized skillet. Let the pan heat up for about a minute, long enough that the eggs will start cooking as soon as they enter the pan but not too long that the butter browns.

procedure.summary: Add your eggs to the heated skillet and cook over medium heat.
procedure.description: Once your pan is warmed up, you can add the eggs. Use any amount of eggs you like, depending on how many people you are feeding. If you want fried or over-easy eggs, just crack the eggs into the pan. If you want to make scrambled eggs, you’ll also want to crack them into the pan but be sure to whisk them quickly. If you are making scrambled eggs, don’t forget to keep stirring them as they cook. If you are nervous about cracking eggs directly into the pan, you can crack them in a bowl first to be sure you catch any stray shell pieces. For scrambled eggs, you can whisk them in the bowl and then add them to the pan.

procedure.summary: Toast your bread while your eggs are cooking.
procedure.description: While your eggs cook, you will want to be sure to get your bread toasting, so it will be done when the eggs finish cooking. Toast the bread until it is golden brown. Use whatever kind of bread you like.

procedure.summary: Flip the eggs once the bottoms have cooked completely.
procedure.description: If you are making a fried or over-easy egg, flip the egg once the bottom has browned. This usually takes about three minutes. If you are making scrambled eggs, continue stirring until the eggs are no longer liquid.

procedure.summary: Cook your eggs until fully cooked.
procedure.description: Whether you are going for a fried egg, an over-easy egg with a gooey center, or soft scrambled eggs, you'll want to watch them carefully and cook them until the whites are completely cooked. Cook scrambled eggs until they hold their shape and are no longer liquid. Don’t forget to add salt and pepper. Think about adding a little bit of cheese to make your eggs on toast that much more delicious.

procedure.summary: Butter your toast while your eggs cool slightly.
procedure.description: Once your toast is golden brown and toasted, you can spread a small amount of butter over your toast. Adding butter will enhance the overall flavor and will eliminate the dryness that can come with toasted bread. You can absolutely use dairy-free butter.

procedure.summary: Assemble the eggs onto the toast.
procedure.description: Once your eggs are cooked, and your toast is toasted, it is time to put it all together. Place the eggs on the buttered toast and enjoy your breakfast.
